discoveredAssets: localhost:80 - Apache 2.4.65 web application with authentication (Flask) - HTTP service on port 80
/login - Login endpoint (POST authentication form, GET form display) - High risk
/home - Home endpoint (redirects to login for unauthenticated users) - Protected resource
http://localhost/ - Root path (redirects to /login) - Entry point

targets.objective: Test for authentication vulnerabilities including: SQL injection in login form (username/password fields), NoSQL injection, brute force protection, default credentials (test:test mentioned in source code comment), session management flaws, CSRF token validation on POST requests, XSS vulnerabilities in error messages, credential enumeration attacks
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint exposed without rate limiting or visible CSRF protection. Source code comment reveals known default test credentials (test:test) that need testing for exploitation potential.

targets.objective: Test for authorization bypass and information disclosure: attempt to access protected resources without authentication, check for path traversal, test HTTP verb tampering (PUT, DELETE, PATCH), verify proper access control enforcement
targets.rationale: Root path redirect suggests application-level access controls. Need to verify if authentication bypass is possible and if protected pages are properly secured.

targets.objective: Test for authorization bypass and IDOR vulnerabilities: attempt access to /home endpoint without authentication, test for user enumeration, check for session hijacking or token reuse vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Protected endpoint that redirects unauthenticated users to /login. Need to verify if authorization controls can be bypassed.

targets.objective: Test for session management flaws: verify proper session termination, test for session fixation, check if logout properly invalidates authentication tokens/cookies, test if user can access protected resources after logout
targets.rationale: Logout functionality should properly invalidate sessions. Need to verify logout implementation for security flaws.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Default test credentials exposed in source code comment: 'TODO: Delete the testing account (test:test)' - indicates test account with known credentials should be removed
[HIGH] Login endpoint (/login) accepts POST requests without visible CSRF protection or rate limiting - potential for brute force attacks
[MEDIUM] Application uses redirect-based authentication redirecting / to /login - typical security pattern but access control effectiveness needs verification
[MEDIUM] Static assets are publicly accessible without authentication - Bootstrap and custom CSS/JS can be analyzed for security information
[LOW] No API documentation (Swagger, OpenAPI) exposed - minimizes information disclosure risk
[LOW] No source code repository (.git), environment files (.env), or sensitive configuration files exposed on web root
